summary: Aesthetic Challenge: book character ➡️ Arya Stark  “Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a...
caption:
Aesthetic Challenge: book character ➡️ Arya Stark

 “Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a snake. Calm as still water. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Strong as a bear. Fierce as a wolverine. Fear cuts deeper than swords. The man who fears losing has already lost. Fear cuts deeper than swords.”

summary: What are your unpopular ASOIAF opinions ?
question: What are your unpopular ASOIAF opinions ?
answer:
I think all of my opinions are unpopular especially on tumblr but well grounded :)

Consider these :

Arya won’t marry Gendry, it has always been one-sided with these two. Gendry will never be a king.

Rhaegar loved Lyanna. Lyanna chose to go with him. They were probably married. 

Daenerys is not the mad queen. Jon will not betray her.

The Faceless Men were behind Joffrey’s death. Oberyn poisoned Tywin.


Thank you for the question :)

summary: Unpopular Opinion: Sansa was more like Lyanna than people think This doesn’t undermine that Lyanna is compared most like Arya. I...
body:
Unpopular Opinion: Sansa was more like Lyanna than people think

This doesn’t undermine that Lyanna is compared most like Arya. I think Lyanna had naive and idealized notions of knighthood, songs, and tales of valor, except she had Arya’s boldness in her to become a Mystery Knight herself. Most the Starks seem a little sheltered from how rotten people can really be, the move south (north for Jon) really shook everyone’s perceptions of the world. 

I think it’s possible Lyanna was much like that, with this idea of valiant knights who protect the weak and uphold the good. A romanticized “Sansa” mindset, with Arya’s attitude and looks to go along with it. It would make sense of why she cried during Rhaegar’s song, and why she decided to run with him so drastically. Perhaps it wasn’t love, or maybe it was, but Rhaegar himself seemed romanticized by everyone who ever met him. 

I think Lyanna had many of the notions that Sansa did starting off AGOT. For example, Sansa would often make excuses for Joffrey and the Lannisters (1, 2, 3) And I’m going to have to say this: Of course Rhaegar wasn’t anything like Joffrey, but there is the fact that he left his wife for Lyanna and she was fine with it. The crown of love and beauty was less shocking, because it was the only prize he could honor her with for her acts as the Knight of the laughing tree. Rhaegar might have consulted with Elia first, who knows? It doesn’t seem like Lyanna herself hated the roses, since she died clutching them so fiercely. 

What promises he made to Lyanna, only GRRM can know, but he doesn’t seem like the type of man someone like Arya would fall for. I also do love that theory that Gendry and Arya’s love is the love that could have never been for Robert and Lyanna, but works better in the next generation. The text also compares her love story to Jenny of Oldstone’s “The love that broke the realm”, and it would be sweet if Jon and Dany’s love, the Dragon and the Wolf, could save the realm. 

Lyanna is a character of her own, not just a collection of many already-existing ones, but it’s nice to see how the new generations learn and grow.

Hey, you can call me Mindset, or Butterfly.
I like: Comics, ASOIAF, music, art, books, sf & fantasy, butterflies, birds, pretty rocks, and many other things. See my sidebar tags and links for more details.

Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

summary: hi! just wondering if you've heard about the theory (i read it on reddit) that jon snow and others will go to dany instead of...
question: hi! just wondering if you've heard about the theory (i read it on reddit) that jon snow and others will go to dany instead of her coming to westeros? apparently they would converge in braavos after dany united the khalasars but wouldn't leave to westeros (which in the meantime had fallen to the others) until the end, and maybe on dragonback. braavos is both important for dany and jon (arya through fake arya)
answer: I don’t see any plot or character reason for Jon to leave Westeros (especially if it’s under attack by the Others), and while Dany’s path may take her through Braavos (among other Free Cities), Arya probably will have left the city by then. Though if she doesn’t, Arya and Dany might encounter there, but it will be because the city is personally important to both of them, a place where they both lived and formed significant memories. (Braavos important to Jon because Jeyne’s probably going there while he’s dead? Um… yeah, in the sense of “I missed my sister coming to the Wall because I was dead at the time… damn… well, now I’ve got to deal with the fact that I was dead and now I’m alive again.”)

tags: a song of ice and fire
this gifset took so long to upload wtf tumblr are you doing
summary:
❆

JON SNOW WEEK
❆

 
→

day three: family 

And Arya… he missed her even more than Robb, skinny little thing that she was, all...
caption:
❆ JON SNOW WEEK ❆
→ day three: family

And Arya… he missed her even more than Robb, skinny little thing that she was, all scraped knees and tangled hair and torn clothes, so fierce and willful. Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had… yet she could always make Jon smile. He would give anything to be with her now, to muss up her hair once more and watch her make a face, to hear her finish a sentence with him.
